title: DOM Manipulation
subject: JavaScript
theory:
JavaScript can change all the HTML elements, attributes, and styles in the page.

*   `element.innerHTML`: Parses HTML string.
*   `element.textContent`: Safer, text only.
*   `element.classList.add('class')`: Clean way to style.
*   `document.createElement('div')`: Creates new node in memory.

examples.explanation: Great for menus and dark mode toggles.

common_mistakes.correction: This leads to XSS (Cross Site Scripting) attacks. Use `textContent` for user-generated content.

interview_questions.question: innerHTML vs textContent?
interview_questions.answer: innerHTML parses HTML tags. textContent renders text as-is (safer/faster).

practice_problems.problem: Create a list item <li> and add it to <ul> with id 'list'.

real_world_use_cases.description: As user scrolls, JS creates new 'Card' elements and appends them to the container.

exam_notes: appendChild moves the node if it already exists.
summary: DOM Manipulation allows you to build Single Page Applications.
